Mix-In: All soft serves are vanilla only and you can choose your favorite childhood cereal including Lucky Charms, Cap'n Crunch, Frosted Flakes, Honey Bunches of Oats, Honey Nut Cheerios, Cookie Crisp, Froot Loops, and many more, that they will blend in with the vanilla soft serve. 3. Toppings: You can choose from a list of toppings they have. Most of them are more dry cereal but a few toppings I spotted are the usual froyo toppings like cookie dough and crushed oreos. You can pay 50 cents extra for other toppings from a list that includes fruit and other yummies. Cup of Soft Serve w/ One Topping: I ordered the soft serve in a cup mixed with one of my favorite super sugary childhood cereals, Cap'N Crunch. I topped it with cheesecake bites, my go-to topping at froyo places. The combination was amazing. The ice cream is so rich and creamy, the amount that they serve is just enough. The cereal mixed in was a little crunchy and grainy, but still so delicious. I highly recommend the soft serves. I think even just the plain soft serve would have been tasty! Teas + Coffee: They also serve matcha teas, rose milk teas, matcha coffees, and thai tea. You can add boba to it if you like. I still need to try these, but I have heard from the other customers, that they do not disappoint. My next visit, I would love to try either the rose milk or matcha coffee. Everything is aesthetically pleasing, I'm sure the taste matches the beauty of these drinks as well!
Its amazing matcha place ! Must visit if in chandler , variety of matcha item on the menu

So happy to have found Rewind in my new neighborhood! The tea here is great! I've tried a few different drinks including lychee peach green tea, immuni-tea, butterfly rose lemonade (personal favorite) which have all been consistently delicious! I love the crystal boba!
They have good shakes and good Boba tea's and really friendly service. I like this place And so did my kids.

Drinks are so beautiful and aesthetic! This is the perfect place to study if you could with friends. I got the butterfly strawberry lemonade and it was fruity and refreshing. Rose milk latte and pink crush were good as well, but I loooved the lemonade.

gr8 thai tea, love that you could adjust the level of sweetness. very clean which is comforting, but also low staff which was no biggy. Katherine was bustin out drinks by herself during a mini rush which was pretty impressive

For some reason I kept thinking..."be kind, rewind!" (SuperStar) when I seen the name of the store. Tonight we came for the ice cream and it didn't disappoint. My bf and shared the cookies and cream on a waffle cone-it had your regular cookies and cream ice cream topped with Cookie Crips cereal and Coco Puffs. I love chocolate soooo this was perfect all around. This place sets itself apart from others by incorporating childhood cereals and oh so great memories. Granted my parents never got us the Cookie Crips because they were "full of sugar". Look at me now! Lol I'd come back again to try the boba teas! I give extra stars to places that have backgrounds for pictures! Bonus!

Don't send your child in alone. The girl behind the counter told our grandson the machine was broken so his kid cup was filled only one-third of the way (about 5 tablespoons) and watery, although he still paid full price and tipped. When he returned to the car he was obviously disappointed so I went in to ask about it. The shift manager told me that's how they come now and then added, "Have a nice day." I guess rudeness and minion size portions is how they roll! As for us, we walked over to Culliver's where my grandson got a real size cup of ice cream with great customer service!

Went in today and tried the Butterfly Rose Lemonade! First of all, WOW so eye pleasing! I didn't even want to mix it because it was so pretty. But I did and first sip, WHOA!! So sweet. Too sweet for me to be honest. But they have so many other drinks that I really want to try. If you love sweet, BRL is for you!!! If youre a plain iced tea kind of person, you won't like this. Lol I did try a sample of the Peach Lychee Green Tea and that was great. I will probably get that next time!

This place was excellent! The boba is high quality, and they give out samples for some of the tea flavors- which I really appreciate!! I got the brown sugar milk tea (dairy free) with boba and it was great. Staff was also very knowledgeable about the flavors offered and their caffeine context. They also have tons of unique flavors, my boyfriend got a captain crunch milkshake and it was really good and we've never had anything else like it! The shop was also very clean and cute, great vibe! Highly recommend as a dessert or boba!

Yummmm. Came here because of the dairy free option of coconut milk. Interesting concept with the milk and cereal. I stuck with the classic cookie dough on a cone with added chocolate chips and this little cone had sooo much doughy goodness in it. Will be returning.

I'm lactose but I'll come back regardless :) The concept is awesome and the staff is always stellar. They serve delicious customizable cereal ice cream cones, bowls, milk shakes, or straight up cereal bowls. Can't go wrong with capn crunch or special k. Be sure to get a drink to go with your ice cream. My favorites are the matcha latte and hojicha latte.

I'd give them 4.5 stars. The workers are always super nice. The place is clean even when it's busy on a Friday night. I got the cookies and cream milkshake which was the right amount of sweet. Usually it's super sweet but there's just hit the sweet spot

This place was so awesome!! My sister & I were thinking of somewhere we could grab a dessert style drink or ice cream & this little gem popped up. It did not disappoint! My sister got the swirl ice cream in a cup with lucky charms cereal blended with the ice cream & lucky charms on top. I ordered the sweet matcha tea! Both were so delicious! I am typically not a fan of ice cream, but I have to say this was so good, I will definitely be back again! I highly recommend you stop in here and check it out for yourself. It's a very clean place and there are so many options when it comes to what you want. I want to try their strawberry cheesecake swirl next! Someone in front of us got it & it looked so good. The prices are fair, we paid just under $13 for both items, now thats a deal! Stop by & get your dripps on!

Will definitely have to try Rewind again! I ordered the Matcha Americano and it hit the spot. Just a nice, refreshing drink where I could customize the sweetness. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Love, love, love that they are able to cater to vegans. There were four ice cream flavors. They also offered plant based milks. They do allow plant based milk subs for certain drinks at an additional cost. Tasted their blueberry cardamom ice cream which was delicious. Their cones and creations look amazing! Would definitely recommend trying.

For boba drinks, it's only 3 stars worthy. The matcha tastes good, nothing amazing. The boba had a weird texture, seemed to be undercooked.. maybe if we tried the ice cream it would get better ratings. But I wouldn't recommend it for boba. Very aesthetic but not so tasty. We're boba fiends seeing as we have our own straws. BYOS!

Dripps has been on my radar since I saw their sign up. They are coming in hot with a new trend a giant drill that mixes in a cereal with an ice cream base. If it sounds crazy it IS and you have to see it yourself! Since it was soft opening some items weren't available. I really enjoyed the fruity pebbles mix-in with ice cream we got. Not only aesthetically pleasing but had the right amount of sweetness. Only thing was off today my ice cream was melting too fast. Get your hands on that Hoji-cha latte! If your into roasted tea like me you'll like the smokey flavor. They also have matcha lattes for matcha lovers and drilled ice cream shakes. The decor is spot on for the gram. Cute tropical prints, yummy on-trend desserts and friendly staff! Thanks Dripps!

Vegan friendly! Some of us can't eat regular ice cream as lactose bothers tummy. They offer lactose free ice cream and they are very good. Drinks they make here is so pretty, I originally found this place via Instagram as so many people posts yummy looking drinks online. Service is very good. Friendly and efficient. Now I learned their menu, if my lactose intolerance person wants ice cream, I know where to go.

We stopped by on a Friday night 40 minutes before their closing time, and the line was still pretty long! The menu is up on the wall so we had enough time to look it over and see what we wanted. The decor is super cute inside, and the lighting is perfect for some great pictures! They do have limited seating and they have a few tables outside as well. We were lucky to find us a little corner to sit down at, as everything else was already occupied. It was dirty though and had ice cream all over. We ended up ordering one Thai tea with boba and a vanilla cone with fruity pebbles and sprinkles. Our total was close to about $12.. Yikes, a little too high in my opinion.... The cashier was beyond friendly and he got us through quickly! We sat down and waited for our treats. The ice cream was pretty good and it was very creamy. We enjoyed the Thai tea (it was nothing special) and the boba was perfectly made. It was the right amount of chewyyyyyy! *It can get pretty expensive especially if there are a lot of ppl in your group. We don't have that big of a sweet tooth, so we ended up sharing our ice cream cone between three people. I can't imagine how much it would've been if we had all ordered one... Do come though cause it's pretty neat inside and a bunch of their other drinks look really cool and tasty! I will be back again to try those out.

Definitely not good for kids. Very offensive music playing. I don't think Yelp would let me repeat the lyrics in a review so how is it okay to assault our ears with that shit. It belongs in the club, or at home. I wouldn't take my family here again. My daughter didn't even like her icecream. It was mushy and dripping and she loves almost all icecream. Avoid!

We were in town for the Aloha Fest and as usual, I was craving something to satisfy my sweet tooth. So of course, I had to do to my search on Yelp and low and behold, it led me right here. What made this place even more enticing is the fact that it was just around the corner from where we were staying. Now what initially drew me to this place is the fact that they serve cereal infused ice cream. I thought "that's different, let's give it a try." They have many different cereals which includes many childhood favorites like Lucky Charms, Cookie Crisp, and Frosted Flakes. Trying to figure out our own mix was a bit overwelming so we all decided to go with something from their signature ice cream menu. The ice cream itself was creamy and definitely hit the spot. Everyone enjoyed what they ordered with the exception of the big teenager. He got the Cookies n Cream and wasn't too happy about it. He said it was too milky and didn't have enough "cookie taste" to it. But besides him, everyone else enjoyed their ice cream (me included). I went with the Thunder Buddies and the Teddy Grahams just gave a nice extra touch to it. But as many other yelpers stated previously, their creations are definitely instagram picture worthy, especially with their decorated wall. So make sure you take a minute or so and snap that picture.

This place was delightful. Yet unexpected. I've never had cereal ice cream before, but this place is near my house and right by Pokitrition.... so I had to try it out. I let my 11yo order for both of us. We had a cinnamon toast crunch milkshake, and a cookie dough milk shake. I had no idea what to expect, and was very pleasantly surprised. Both were fantastic!!! A little on the pricey side, but worth it for an occasional treat. We'll be back for sure

First time was tonight after dinner and the place was super cute!! Very simple and clean, such friendly staffs and great service! I ordered an ice cream swirl in a cup and it came out way better than I thought, the way it got mixed together with one choice of your mix, PERFECT Would come back again, they have my business! Next time I'll try out the beautiful drinks, it's nice how they used canvases with photos of their drinks as advertisement.

Perfect for the Arizona heat. Saw this place on social media and knew I wanted to try this place out when I visited. The specialty drill infused ice cream was a real treat and the you can't go wrong with the drinks here either. *Strawberry Shortcake Ice Cream Super nostalgic! Definitely an upgraded taste to the strawberry shortcake ice cream bars from my childhood. The strawberries and cream cheese taste mend together really well. The ice cream has hints of graham cracker and the flavors are well incorporated with one another. *Strawberry Matcha Latte Very pretty before mixing and letting the flavors get to know each other. The matcha flavor is really rich here and the strawberry jam adds a good amount of sweetness to the drink. *Rose Milk Latte I really liked this one since it had a mellow flavor. The rose hints blends nicely with the tea. The normal adjustments are just enough where the sweetness doesn't overpower all the other flavors.

One of the things that is conspicuously absent from the area around my neighborhood is a place to get ice cream. The Dairy Queen and Cold Stone in our area are a little too far away for us to conveniently just go out to get an ice cream. So I was glad to see this place open up essentially across the street from us and I had to give it a try. I discovered that Rewind is yet another restaurant that was apparently inspired by Christina Tosi and her Milk Bar in New York. I ordered a Lychee Matcha and an Ice Cream Swirl with Cookie Crisp cereal and Reese's Cups. This location appeared to be fairly popular, although it was still relatively new when I visited. The service was great and the quality of the items I ordered was very good. The only downside is that it's a bit pricey for it to be a just a neighborhood ice cream shop. Rewind is probably better suited for a high end strip mall or an indoor mall. Good place to bring a date if you want to impress them, though.

There's a saying now that we eat with our eyes and this place is a prime example of picture perfect dessert. Not only the dessert is well put together, the interior as well. Now there's a big trend going on with grassy walls with neon signs and there's one implemented here to show off your dessert! These places are definitely a reminder that we're slowly started to get all the "Cali-like" boba/ ice cream places. Phoenix is really needing more places like this and I'm very happy it's in a prime spot. They're located next to Pokitrition, near off the 101 and Ray. The cool thing is that the creators of Pokitrition also made this place too! I didn't get to try the boba just yet but the ice cream is great. While being one of the reasons I don't have a 6 pack yet, this just makes it worse cause I'd probably be craving this place. KITH Treats is also a place that I get reminded of about this concept. This place is going to blow up and be packed. I'll be back for more. CERTIFIED BANGER
Loved it super refreshing! For my strawberry matcha I would probably ask for it less sweet next time

Very cute shop, extremely instagram friendly with the green plant wall and neon sign. Super cute decor and couches, everything was spotless! The menu was a little confusing. I decided to do the standard combination because I didn't know what to choose based on my own combo. They have a lot of cereal topping options and the consistency is great! It is much better than cold stone creamery. It's around $7 for a cone or milkshake. They also have boba and fresh matcha tea. I'll have to try that next time. The strawberry shortcake was definitely my favorite, they placed fresh slices of strawberry on the side with sprinkled cinnamon crunch on top. It was a good size, almost too big to finish. The cone tasted very good. Definitely worth checking out if you're interested in mix-in style ic cream

My first time coming here and I like it! Little cute shop and they have cream infused ice cream serving premium matcha sourced straight from Japan featuring layered drinks plus boba, but optional. If you grew up and loved cereals and now you're tired eating cereals or simply because you don't have time to eat in the morning for breakfast and you have a favorite childhood cereals, this is the place to go! They have cereal shakes such as Fruity Pebbles, Cinnamon Toast Crunch or Oreos mixed together with super premium 16% butter fat ice cream and topped off with one of these choices like graham cracker crumbs, gummy bears, chocolate or caramel drizzle and teddy grahams. I ordered their brown sugar milk tea with boba and matcha latte. The price is right for the size, I wished they could put more matcha on my latte. The boba is a bit firm, but it works. Their other desserts look delicious too and I will come back to try their other yummy items in their menu.

Lucky #777! Happy New Year! Let's start the new year off on a *sweet* and lucky 5-star note~! Rose Tea Fact: Rose tea has several beneficial effects including boosting the immune system, treating a sore throat, boosting your digestive health, and has high levels of antioxidants and vitamin C. So drink it! I've been seeing my girl Lien S. checking in here and I have been meaning to drop in for a while but I never seem to be in this area. And with the owners of Pokitrition being the mastermind behind Dripps, how could I not? And now that I've have their Rose Milk Latte, I'm hooked! Matcha Coffee, Hojicha Latte = Meh! Coconut Matcha, Sweet Matcha, Strawberry Matcha = Yes! Rose Milk Latte = Yaaas!!! I haven't tried much of their ice cream selection besides the Caramel Apple since it's cold both outside and in my heart but they look good. Dripps also offers a soy milk option for their drinks too so rejoice! I'll be back again and again for that Rose Milk Latte. Pea flower tea? Sign me up!

Visiting from out of town, read the reviews so decided to try it out since it closed a little late. Got there just right before they closed, a little expensive for 3 drinks and ice cream in a cup. Drinks weren't all that great, even the ice cream didn't taste good. Waste of my money, I would say bcz didn't even drink half of my drink before I decided to toss it in the trash!

This girl named "Stephanie" took my order and was so rude and she had the worst attitude, I ordered one ice cream and it took over 20 minutes and I could see her on her phone in the back while I was waiting. The worst experience ever and the worst worker I've met anywhere!
We went here for a drink after eating poke. I thought the matcha coffee was good. I like green tea and cold brew so makes sense. They have several other unique drinks I want to try
So busy... but worth it! DELICIOUS! The staff were so nice and gave everyone samples while they waited! Only recommendation... a bigger location!!!!

I'm so glad there is another boba place to visit when I'm in Phoenix. I had ordered the iced matcha latte, which was perfectly made the way I like it (you can definitely taste the matcha, but it's not too overpowered by the sweetness of the sugar and milk). The cereal milk ice cream was also delicious. I almost forgot to take a picture, since it looked so good.
Thunder buddies was delicious! Ice cream had a great consistency and was not overly sweet. Would love to come back and try others when I'm in the area.
Very nice dessert spot. If I didnt live so far I'd be here once a week! The Butterfly Lemonade is EXCEPTIONAL!!!

I had the strawberry shortcake cone and it was so good! It was also huge and I couldn't finish it. Their teas are also really good, and the staff is friendly. Very clean and cozy inside. Will definitely be coming back.

Very yummy new build your own cereal soft serve shop! They have so many different mix ins you can choose from (almost all of them Being ice cream) and also a bunch of different toppings. The staff was also very friendly and helpful to new customers. Interior design was so pretty and very bright making me want to stay and eat my soft serve there and hangout. Definitely coming back

Local slow churned ice cream with the perfect amount of butter fat. Mix it with your favorite childhood cereal and this brings you back to childhood memories. This is a must try in Phoenix and perfect for any hot day to cool down. Once you try this, you'll want more.

I visited Dripps with my husband. The decor was super cute and I liked that they had a wall for the Instagram pictures. One of the employees helped us out by explaining the menu and helping us pick our options. My husband ended up getting one of their signature ones, cookies and cream. I ended up making my own shake with fruity pebbles. I loved the variety and how I could make my ice cream the way I wanted.

Sooo, I love icecream. But dripps has put two of my most favorite things together so I can enjoy cereal and soft serve! So creamy and crunchy! Glad they brought this icecream that is a must try! Friendly knowledgeable staff! Definitely worth the wait! Have already gone 3 times in a week!

Worst place I ever visited. If you order via online as exactly they instructed at the door, you obviously have to wait for +20 mins to get your order. And when you make any sensible suggestions, the workers will be furiously mad and rude to you.
Rewind is amazing! I had the green tea soft serve and the pink drink with crystal boba. Both were very tasty and I'd definitely recommend.

I love the atmosphere of this place. They have plenty of natural lighting, good wifi, deskspace, and even a small sofa for lounging. This is a great spot for studying or bringing friends/kids to play board games. Definitely one of my new Chandler favorites!

Killin it at Dripp's! LA Ktown native traveling south to AZ for vacation with family and who would've thought there would be a dessert gem in this desert! At first glance, the store looks really clean and decorated moderate and appropriate. Alot of cute areas for photo ops(IG Worthy), sit down, relax and study. Being a first timer, the staff there were super friendly when explaining their concept of blending ice cream and treats. Strawberry Shortcake: if Cold Stones was the ice cream mixing giant of the 2000's... Dripps is the ice cream mixing innovators of the future.. seriously. The ice cream was soft and creamy and the flavor profiles of the extra mix ins were delightedly recognizable yet worked well to compliment each other. I really enjoyed all the other extra candy toppings that i got to choose. This treat was just that: A TREAT! Also try the Thunder Buddies! My nephew got it and i loved how well the Reese's blended well with the ice cream! I will definitely be back for more on my next AZ trip, thanks for the awesome visit Dripps!

Came here for their grand opening. I think it went pretty smoothly! I got a mix in of the fruity pebbles with fruity pebbles topping in a drip cone. It was really good! And also a strawberry matcha latte. I was a little disappointed with the latte only cause I feel like I didn't get much of the strawberry pure. I love the concept though!
Perfect matcha, perfect Thai Tea, perfectly cooked boba, lovely people working! First time we got the Rose tea and sweet matcha, second we got Thai tea and rose tea again perfect spot!

Amazingly delicious ice cream, great service and yummy drinks with a great atmosphere and dont forget to take a pic of your stuff next to the drip it like it's hot sign! Best ice cream I've ever had without a doubt!

Dripps Soft Opening is this week so we stopped by to try out their selection! Here's the vanilla soft serve with oreo mixed in, topped with pocky sticks. It's amazing how the infusion of their ingredients create a completely new experience. They served it in a delicious waffle cone decorated with a sweet drizzle. It felt like we were kids again eating ice cream on a hot summer day. I definitely recommend trying this spot out, they have a variety of mix-ins and add-ons for you to choose to your hearts desire. I'm excited to return again and test out more combinations!!
Love the service and the ice cream! We also tried the drinks, the butterfly rose lemonade is so good!! Highly recommend

This was an awesome experience, a little more than I'd like to spend on milkshakes but definitely a cool experience and I highly recommend doing it at least once, the staff was great the facilities were clean. I will say seating is limited so it can get crowded.

Fun little shop, & friendly service. I've tried both the lychee & peach green tea, and mango black tea; both were delicious. FYI- The butterfly rose lemonade literally taste like a rose so if you're not a fan of your drinks tasting like a flower, then you may not like this one in particular. I cannot eat dairy so I have yet to try their dairy based drinks, however they did tell me that they can substitute with almond or coconut. I will be returning to try out more. :)

If you want to pay $7 for a scoop of crunchy vanilla ice cream, then this place might be for you. I was utterly baffled by the concept of this place, but curiosity got the better of me. In hindsight, the $4.50 "bowl of cereal with milk" should have been a major red flag. While the first layer of caramel and brownies that topped my creation were admittedly rather tasty, the crunchy mess below was immensely unsatisfying. I'm pretty confused by other reviews pointing out ample parking and "competitive pricing," which were not my experience at all.

After seeing other yelpers checking in at this place, we figured we would give this place a try on a Friday night. For ice cream, it is all vanilla base. Then you pick a flavor, a topping and an ingredients and they will create one just for you. You have a choice of having it on a waffle cone or a cup. I picked the waffle cone (and I regret it later because it was too much and messy). They also sell unique drinks that I would like to try next time. Since it was my first time, I ordered one from premade menu (I think it was called Oreo something). It took them at least 15 minutes to make the ice cream, but we did not mind to wait since it was a Friday night. If you want to go in and out of there, just keep that in mind. I also tried a sip of the Strawberry Macha Latte. It has a unique taste to it, but I am not sure if I would order it for me. Overall, the service was friendly, prices are a bit high but once again I love local businesses. I will come back to try something else again

Delicious milkshakes. I had my reservations about a place using prepackaged cereal as a main ingredient in the majority of their dishes. But I was wrong. They. Are. Delicious. I also really enjoy watching the assembly process.
Loved it! Perfect for a late night treat! Highly recommend trying out their special shakes

Went here a few weeks ago. We were there later in the evening and there was basically no line. My worldview was completely changed by fruity pebbles in my ice cream! We also got the Apple Jax milkshake...it was good, more of a large ice cream as opposed to a milkshake. Only reason for 4 stars was it took a while to get our order.

We had the Thunder Buddies and the Minion's Treat. Substituted banana for cheesecake on the minion's treat. The treats were delicious, the ambience was modern and hip. I'll definitely be coming back. By far the best ice cream in this part of the valley. My only mild complaint is that I wish they were a little more diligent about wiping down the tables. Go here for instagram-worthy ice cream!

This place is easy to get to, is clean and the staff are nice. I had the Matcha with Strawberry puree and it was so delicious. I thought it would be too sweet and not enough matcha but it was perfect! My friend got the pink crush and that was really good too! Will be back here again

This place is super creative for having cereal-infused ice cream, and it was super delicious too! The shop environment was really Instagram-worthy and the people working were extremely friendly and I got my order within a few minutes. Highly recommend this place if you're looking for dessert that has different textures, perfect for summer!

What friendly service! Walked in looking for a caffeine kick and was immediately greeted with a smile and info about what they served. Fun, little place with a hip atmosphere. Drink was hand delivered to me and oh my goodness....so delicious.

Pretty novel idea - mixing in fave breakfast cereals with ice cream - so it has a very familiar taste since they all have a vanilla ice cream base but is in that sweet treat realm. I had the Minion in shake form which was Frosted Flakes, banana and chocolate syrup all mixed together, which was pretty good. My son had a shake and had just Crunch Berries mixed in. On the plus side, it was a shake with Crunch Berries, on the downside, it was just vanilla ice cream, milk and Crunch Berries.... a little too close to just eating some breakfast cereal with milk. Good-ish but not great for the $5 I paid for it. If you go, choose one of their concoctions, you will definitely need a little more added to it than just cereal or it's gonna fall a little flat.

I probably would have given a 3 star, but my 2 visits left a bitter aftertaste. On my first visit it was really packed. So I couldn't ask about pricing or how ordering worked. My sister and I thought the ice cream was good, but really heavy and sweet. The service was fast, but not really friendly since it felt like they were in training mode and I felt really rushed. The cashier making my order also forgot I ordered a second ice cream. So I had to remind her. On top of that, I kept getting weird looks that I couldn't decipher... maybe annoyed. Plus, she also forgot my extra topping, which is 50 cents extra. I had to remind her yet again. It was a really meager amount too. She also got chocolate drizzle all over the sides of the cup, but she kind of quickly wiped it down when she was instructed to. But I still got chocolate all over my hands. The ice cream was also really expensive for how small the portion size was. I paid about $16 for the two ice creams and the extra topping on both. So it ended up being around $6ish for each. I had no idea what the pricing would be until after I ordered because the price wasn't listed for the signature items on their wall menu. The cashier also didn't give me a receipt until I asked, so I had no idea what I paid since I missed what the total was due to the choatic environment. On a side note, when paying, you swipe for debit and insert chip for credit. The cashier didn't explain this. So my card wouldn't go through when I chose debit and inserted my card.. She didn't bother explaining why my card wouldn't go through. So I just ended up guessing and tried swiping. My card finally went through. They really need to take the time to communicate no matter how busy it is. It left a bad impression. I decided to give it another try the next day since I was in the area. I didn't know what time they opened, so I ended up coming too early and waited close to 30 minutes. When I entered, I heard the cashier kind of groan or make some sound similiar to a groan. I felt unwelcomed, but I ignored it since I waited 30 minutes since my sister really wanted a drink. I ended up getting two drinks: the Matcha Coffee and the Strawberry Matcha Latte. The cashier for this second visit also did not tell me about the payment process. She chose credit for me, and I inserted my card since I remembered the other day that I chose debit and needed to swipe. This was annoying because if I had a card without a chip, and I tried swiping after she chose credit for me my card wouldn't have gone through. Anyway, the coffee drink for the price definitely wasn't worth it. They add plain cane sugar for the coffee. For the price, I was hoping for honey or a higher quality sweetener. But the strawberry latte was good. It just needed more strawberry syrup. Although how they make the drinks seem inconsistent. I was watching the drink making process, and the cashier was using two different brands of almond milk because it must have ran out. Anyway, my sister noticed that her almond milk was low quality and tasted bad before she mixed her latte. I didn't even tell her that it was low quality milk, until after she told me her observation. They used Great Value almond milk in her drink, while they used Simple Truth in mine. For the price, they should use a good brand of milk substitute. The cheap stuff tends to taste bad. She liked the matcha though. She thought it might have been a high quality matcha. I have to agree on that. I ended up googling them since I was curious about the reviews because my overall experience was pretty bad. When browsing the pictures, I noticed that our ice cream was definitely much smaller and it was more of a heavy concrete texture compared to the light swirls in the pictures. I took the ice creams togo. So I guess they cut the size down to get the lid on. They should have told me I would get more than 50% less ice cream if I got a lid. They need to get bigger lids or something. Although what angered me was that in the pictures, the Cookies and Cream ice cream had Cocoa Puffs and Cookie Crisps. However, my ice cream definitely did not have any of those toppings. When I ate it the day before, I just assumed they blended it into my ice cream. Lastly, the Minion's Treat was either missing the almonds or it was such a skimpy amount that I couldn't see it or taste it. The ice creams in the pictures had a decent amount of toppings for the exact ice creams we got. I don't know why we barely had any toppings and some of our toppings were missing. We are lactose intolerant. This was supposed to be a rare treat worth the stomach pains and other problems. The only nice thing about the experience was that the owner/manager/trainer or whatever her position is seemed nice. She told the girl making my order to wipe the chocolate drizzle off the sides of my cup because she was about to hand it to me without wiping it. She also got me a togo menu when I asked for one.

They're nice and helpful here. They'll give you lots of time while suggestions while ordering. Their menu is really limited for a boba shop, no taro which is a bummer. I wish their menu was bigger but what they do have is good!

I had high hopes for this place. When I first entered it was really clean and service folks were really nice. I ended up grabbing the strawberry shortcake (one size only). When I was rung up I thought it was a mistake but it was over $7 (seemed expensive). Once they made my order I dove right in. The fresh fruit was nice and the ice cream it self had a mix of graham crackers inside which gave it a unique crunch. While it tasted ok, I wasn't super impressed and given the price I was less than thrilled. Don't think I'll be returning.

Let's start off with the positives. Rewind has a really trendy interior aesthetic, and I think their employees are really polite and efficient. However, that's where the pros end. I don't think this place is bad- I just think it's extremely mediocre. Drinks are passable, but very sugary and basic. The desserts are even more generic. There is literally an item on the menu that is straight-up cereal and milk. If this place was super cheap I would be more understanding, but its actually pretty expensive for what you're getting. Overall, not horrible? I would recommend this for a first date, I guess.

Found this place thru an Arizona based foodie account. I am a matcha fanatic and I ordered the matcha ice cream. The quality is fantastic, but if the owner ever reads this- substitute the chocolate pocky sticks for matcha ones!
We love this place. They got great boba and you can also adjust the sugar level to your liking. Ice cream looks delicious might try it next time. But definitely recommend the Thai tea boba :)

Great ice cream I got the matcha tea I cream but two issues: #1 came a with chocolate pocky sticks instead of matcha. #2 greatly expensive, I bought 2 for $16. Definitely not a great deal. But at the end of the day they at least deserve 4 stars because I was impressed with the taste.
Fairly average milk tea place for my taste. Some of the drink flavors seemed off from what you'd expect.
My brother took us here & I gotta say..... one of the best boba places here in AZ. There's one closer to where we're staying for our summer vacay, but we drove out a little just for this place!
Best boba in AZ! So yummy and tapioca is always fresh and chewy! I recommend the brown sugar milk tea or the strawberry matcha latte! Both are so delicious!

Walking into dripps I instantly felt refreshed. The space is bright and vibrant. It's small but just big enough to seat a moderate amount of ice cream eaters. Dripps produces Instagram worthy treats that are catered to cereal addicts. But the don't only have cereal as a topping. You can easily choose from several different candy bars or melty drizzles. There is something for everyone. I ordered a milkshake. Not just any milk shake but a snickers crushed and infused melody of crunchy vanilla goodness. It was delish. My bf ordered a sundae with Capitain crunch and my mom ordered a surprisingly delicious vanilla cone chucked full of strawberry flavor and snicker dust on top (copy cat). We all enjoyed our treats and sat at a cute table near the window. This place gets busy pretty quick but the line seems to move rather quickly. I don't enjoy giving Reviews that are under 5 stars if I enjoyed my experience at a restaurant or establishment. In fact it's annoying to see someone give a rave review under a 4 star rating. *rolls eyes* I'm giving 4 stars because although I enjoyed my experience I was pretty shocked to see how small the ice cream cup was that my bf received. It literally looked like a kids serving. And that in itself costs $6. My milkshake was huge and the cone was huge. I looked around and saw others with larger servings as well. Maybe they messed up the order? Idk. I'll be back again but I don't suggest ordering a cup of ice cream. Get a milkshake or cone.

I went here the other day with my sister and I was surprised by how unique the flavors were! The place itself was designed really nicely and they even offer an aesthetic backdrop for your boba drinks and ice cream. I got the matcha & strawberry with boba and it was so good, it was a little sweet so the next time I come back I'm probably going to have to lessen the sweetness, and my sister got a rose milk tea latte with boba, which was also surprisingly good. Not only were the drinks delicious, but the service was extremely good and the workers were very friendly! Overall, it's definitely a place worth checking out.
I like this place due to great location, amazing nice employees, and interior wise is nice relaxed place. Good place to hang out.

This place is delicious! I love their cereal based soft serve. It is breakfast as desert and each bite turns me into a small child again. I have tried a few of their drinks and most have an ingredient I don't like such as matcha or Jasmin but my friends who are not against floral as a beverage love their drinks.

I forgot to post my review on this spot a few weeks ago but wanted to go back to it since it was a fun place experience. Mostly really into the decor of this spot, if your looking to go somewhere cute and trendy for pics. But I also really liked their boba tea and they have some really unique options to choose from. I'll be back to try their ice cream soon...looked amazing too!

My boyfriend and I tried this place and it was pretty good! You get to choose what kind of cereal or ingredients get blending into your ice cream or milkshake & then what cereal, candy or other toppings go on top! Good place to go if you're craving ice cream or just something sweet

First time here and won't be the last. Thank you to the friendly staff. The strawberry cheesecake was rich but not overly sweet. The graham crackers on the ice cream stayed crunchy till the last bite! Both of the matcha drinks were fantastic!
I took my son and his bestie here for a quick treat. Really loved it. The drinks are as refreshing as they are pretty, and the staff is very friendly!

The rose milk latte was delicious and pretty to look at. The matcha coconut was refreshing without being too sweet the boba was chewy and fresh. Will go again. A little bit of a long wait but I think that is because they were cutting open a coconut. The ice cream looked delicious as well different options. Small menu but since each drink is hand crafted the taste is superb and doesn't need a big menu to compensate.

I liked it, but there are a lot of other ice cream places I'd rather go. Yes, there is a uniqueness with the creation process and some of the different mix-ins, but it only satisfied my craving for ice cream. The ice cream didn't speak to me and I like it when my ice cream speaks to me.

Yum-mmy!!!! Me and my husband stopped in here and ordered ice cream. After we placed our orders we were chatting with the girl that took our order about the other items they make. I first off have to say that I absolutely LOVE matcha! It's a great natural source of caffeine as well as a rich source of antioxidants. She asked if we have heard of matcha, I simply said yes but definitely went into my matcha connoisseur mode. She pointed out photos of fresh drinks they make and some including matcha. She proceeds with telling us that they get their matcha directly shipped in from Japan! Which made me ecstatic!! Back to reviewing our order, I got the Strawberry Shortcake and my husband the Cookies & Cream which were both lovely to look at, delicious and super filling. We'll be back for sure for dessert but I'll be back asap to try their matcha drinks!

Got the rose milk latte, which was delicious. I'm glad this place started serving boba! We got a small, I believe, for ~$5. Tables were sort of filthy, so we had to wipe them down ourselves before sitting, but I believe there was only one person working behind the counter at the time, and he was understandably very busy with orders by himself. The flavors are pretty unique, so I'd go again!

My friend and I found this place on a whim, and we are so glad we stopped by. Many people come here for ice cream, but you have got to try the drinks as well. I love the Strawberry Matcha Latte, and all the coffee drinks.

I visited the day after their grand opening and it was still super packed, but worth it for their soft serve with their cinnamon toast mixed in and cheesecake bites on top. I just wish there was more cheesecake bites on top. I also got their rose milk and was slightly disappointed because there just wasn't enough rose for me. However, I will definitely be back to try other drinks and to get more soft serve. The space could be considered small, but has a super photogenic leafy wall for photos. It was also super nice of them to continue their BOGO deal for the week a total steal!

Around the chandler area this evening and saw this on yelp. Saw that they had matcha and I LOVE matcha from back in Cali. The matcha coffee was perfect after a big meal. Please open one out in the west valley! We need more stuff like this!!
Love the vibe! Got the Jasmine Milk tea & loved it. Great choice of music. Will definitely come back.

I have been wanting to try this place for a few months and today I finally made it in. So happy I did. I had a small scoop of the matcha ice cream with fruity pebbles mixed in and it was DELICIOUS. I didn't get her name but the sweet young lady that helped me was very knowledgeable and suggested I get the matcha coffee. She was even kind enough to Google items that we were unsure had gluten in it. I really appreciated her assistance and I will definitely go back again! Oh yeah and I got two matcha coffees. One for the ride home to Sahuarita and one for tmrw morning.
This is very high quality and tastes super good! You can get super creative with the flavors and mix-ins. I'll be coming back many more times!
I work across the street and tried rewind for the first time today! I am in love with it. The girl in the front was the sweetest! I definitely will be going back!

Our first time here and we loved it! My husband had a plain vanilla on a waffle cone and I had Bourbon Caramel which was to die for delicious! Not too sweet and the ice cream was so creamy. The prices were so reasonable for such great quality. Both staff members were very friendly. We will be back!

For the cost and quality of ingredients, I'd say this place is mediocre. They are stingy with the matcha (soft serve and mixed drinks) so the flavor is very subtle and overpowered by the sugar/dairy. I got the Matcha Americano and it was very watered down. It's probably one of the better options for matcha you'll get in Phoenix, but does not compare to places you'd find in California such as Cafe Matcha Maiko.

With all the hype over cereal mixed into ice cream at Dripps, my family had to give them a try. We ordered the Strawberry Shortcake cereal infused ice cream cone, a strawberry matcha latte & the rose milk latte. The Strawberry Shortcake was captain crunch cereal, cheesecake & strawberries mixed into vanilla ice cream and topped with graham crackers & strawberry sauce. The ice cream mix was good, sweeter with the cereal & add ins. The strawberry matcha latte had strawberry pure on the bottom, then milk layer and topped with matcha. The rose milk latte has rose syrup on the bottom, milk layer in the middle and topped with blue butterfly pea flower tea. Both drinks were good but similar to what other boba places are serving nowadays. I would recommend the cereal infused ice cream cone over the drinks because it is more unique in flavor.

Omg!! You need this place in your life especially vegans!! Vegan ice cream was amazing, plus you get to add your own toppings! So so good always trying to do dairy free and I will definitely be here every other week. Soo good
Delicious! Sometimes the wait is pretty long if there are a lot of people in line, but people in line means they have a great product!

Delicious and unique ice cream/drinks. I don't think the ice cream is worth the seven bucks though UNLESS the person making it puts in the effort into make it aesthetically pleasing. Because come one, that's what most people go in there for. One visit my ice cream cone looked squashed and lopsided, the next it was tall and proud with strawberry syrup that I didn't receive on my first strawberry shortcake cone. I'd take an out of town person here to show that AZ does have some cool spots, but I wouldn't come here on the regular. *side note- no substitutions on the signature combos. This includes simply omitting a topping due to allergies.

I first came here during their grand opening when the line was so long that it snaked out of their store. I did not regret the wait at all as the their ice cream and boba did not disappoint. I ordered their rose milk tea both times I visited which is both visually pleasing and tastes really good! I also ordered their famous cereal ice cream both times I visited which even had my mom impressed who wasn't planning to eat any of the ice cream. The worker at the counter was very nice and gave our family good recommendations from the menu as well as samples. She tried her best to accommodate to our needs and our orders came out pretty fast. I plan to visit again soon! The atmosphere of the place as well as their location is nice as well.

I was excited to try this new ice cream shop since it's walking distance from my house. They mix cereals into their ice cream. I wasn't too interested in trying that but did have cookies and cream mixed in with a little chocolate syrup as a topping. The ice cream is sickening sweet - I couldn't finish it. Worst ice cream I've ever eaten. They are expensive also. They weren't busy on a Friday night - now I know why.
Amazing milkshake and great service. I will definitely be back to this local place. This was my first time

After seeing this place pop up on my yelp, I thought id give it a try since we were in the area. We went on a Sunday afternoon so there was no waiting and we were able to order right away. My husband ordered the Thai tea and I ordered the vanilla soft serve infused with fruity pebbles topped with circus animal cookies. You can order from one of their pre made menu or create your own. They offer a variety of ingredients you can infuse into your ice cream. The way the mix the ingredients into the ice cream makes it taste so good. I got mine in a cup so I can share with my little one or you can order your ice cream on a waffle cone. They also offer drinks & teas if you're not in the mood for some ice cream. Definitely come try this place out :)
AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS! Such unique flavors that blew me away. Highly recommend! The workers are incredibly sweet and nice.
Manager reached out letting me know that the issue had been resolved so that it would not happen again. I've been back several times since and it has been great every time.
This ice cream was so tasty. Cute, quaint little place, and very sweet cashier at the front. She was quick to make our order and it was a beautiful presentation. Love it for a quick treat.

Very cute location! Very aesthetic. They have ice cream and boba options. Seemed a little pricey for what the ice cream was - $6 for vanilla soft serve blended with a cereal and 1 topping. I had Cinnamon Toast Crunch with honey drizzle. It comes in a cup or cone at no additional cost.

A very great ice cream place, the portion is hugeeeee! Love the different variety they give, mixed with numerous selections of cereals. The rose milk tea was pretty good, definitely would recommend for the ice cream lovers to come and try! Ice cream definitely tasted very balanced. Not too sweet not too bland!
Ice cream was a little too sweet for us. The boba was just ok too! Nice store but probably wouldn't go here all the time for dessert.

Love Dripps! Such a unique concept to mix cereal in with the ice cream. Every flavor I have tried has been delicious. My favorite is the Reese Puffs mixed in with Butterfinger topping. Such a yummy treat!

I was here over Christmas day, it was nice and quiet. The backdrop and neon lights is key to be deemed an IG destination as you do a quick photo sesh to make those likes and comments rain. I had the sweet matcha drink while my friends ordered the strawberry cheesecake soft serve and the rose milk tea. I was able to try their orders and I liked it all. I would definitely come back here.
Great environment and friendly staff. It was my first time here and they walked me through what I could do and then what their favorite was. Will deff be back again!

I found this place on Instagram and was in awe. It was closer to my boyfriends house than it was mine so I took a screen shot of the name and knew when I went down there we'd have to try it. Yesterday we so happened to pass it on our way home. Although it was a gloomy raining cold day I said I HAVE TO TRY IT. I was impressed. I did mix in fruit loops and he even told me that was a bad idea, yet somehow couldn't keep his spoon out of my cup. It was absolutely phenomenal, and I love soft serve. This is better because you get to mix in what you want and the soft serve is very creamy and thicker than others I've had. Only downside is it's a bit pricey for (~$7) for a small (cup) of ice cream. Worth it and will go back!
The best milk tea shop love that they have milk alternatives. Top Drinks in my opinion, Iced Matcha w coconut milk or Rose Milk tea w Almond milk

I would have to say that I'm not a huge fan of their matcha drinks, but I did enjoy their Matcha Soft Serve. I think it might be because there was so much milk I couldn't really taste the matcha. But, I mentioned I did like the soft serve. It was incredibly rich in flavor and wasn't super sweet, which was perfect. I got it the chocolate dipped cone topped with gold flakes and chocolate shavings. And believe it or not, the chocolate complimented the matcha very well. The shop overall was super cute and aesthetic so it's definitely photogenic. It's quite close to my house so I'd probably come back if I had a sweet craving.

I found your place yesterday and got an ice cream swirl. Then I insisted on coming back the next day with my adult daughter and boyfriend. I bought another ice cream swirl. Daughter and boyfriend ordered a milkshake and a ice cream swirl in a cup. Both of my cones were pure perfection. My daughter enjoyed the flavor is her milkshake but thought it was thin. Her boyfriend got a swirl that looked like it was in a child's cup. I saw other customer receive their orders and get larger portions and large containers. I didn't say anything until we left when he said he enjoyed his ice cream but it was too small of a serving for $6+. I was alarmed to hear that he had not ordered your one scoop serving. Very disappointing! Update: they are allowing the bf to get another serving on their dime. Thank you for making it right.

My boyfriend and I wanted to check this place out for awhile now, but the location is so far from where we live. The inside of this place is so cute and clean, definitely insta worthy. What I ordered was a cone mixed in with cinnamon toast crunch, topped with cheesecake bites. Costed roughly around $6. I've read yelp reviews about ice cream being costly, but lemme tell ya, it was so much ice cream, I couldn't even reach the cone!! It was so good and my tummy was so happy, but full at the same time. This ice cream cone could definitely be shared with others. My boyfriend got a milk shake with apple jacks mixed in. They also topped the milkshake with the cereal as well. My boyfriend enjoyed it a lot, he finished the whole thing. We will definitely be back soon and can't wait to try their teas.

This place is extremely cute. Very aesthetic with a wall that I've seen a ton of people take pictures at. The ice cream is also great! A little overpriced for the cones but yummy nevertheless. The boba was also delicious (it was sweet and soft). Thai tea is my go-to and they can customize the sweetness levels.

This place was having a bogo special, so I was definitely interested in checking it out. My friend and I got the rose milk tea and the presentation was nice. It was in three layers: pink, white, and baby blue. You can also get it with boba. You're encouraged to stir it so all of the layers will mix. It was really good! Lastly, this place has really nice wallpaper and a wall of leaves for a good Instagram moment. Next time I go, I will try the ice cream. It looks like everyone around me got an ice cream and seemed to enjoy it.

Awesome ice cream concept! They mix in your favorite breakfast cereal to vanilla ice cream to make new flavors. The texture is a little different but still overall a great dessert! I tried the caramel apple and it was amazing!! All the flavors blended really well and the cheesecake pieces were an awesome addition. I recommend going back to try every combination! I think I'll get the cinnamon toast crunch next!

DRIPPS is my answered prayer and biggest blessing to the Chandler area this year. I'm not kidding when I say I come here at least once a week. When they first opened in September, it was even more than that, taking advantage of their soft opening and grand opening discount and BOGO. They are an awesome company, from the owners over at Pokitrition. The star here is CEREAL INFUSED SOFT SERVE. And no, it is not just some cereal just sprinkled into the ice cream. It is generous amounts of cereal of your choice literally DRILLED in and it is the best cereal ice cream in the world. I am a huge fan of Christina Tosi's Milkbar cereal ice cream, but Dripps takes it to a whole other level. I can assure you your favorite childhood cereal is among their choices. They do have signature creations you could choose from and mix and match toppings, but what I love to do is just choose a cereal and use the same cereal as topping. Their "supporting actor" I would say is their matcha drinks. If you love matcha, you will be in heaven. They use real QUALITY matcha. Great flavor, good caffeine kick without the jitters. Next favorite is the rose milk tea. It's not too "flowery" it is more milky which I love. Their milk teas are good as well. The only one negative thing is the boba balls are not as soft as I would love them to be but I enjoy milk teas without boba so they get a pass. The whole concept is just amazing and I'll shout it from the rooftops if I could. I LOVE DRIPPS!
Love this local spot and love its sister company pokitrition. I think it's amazing they have a coconut based ice cream that is just as delicious!
I love Dripps, they have great customer service. The staff is friendly and helpful. The ice cream is amazing, the cereal is not soggy at all.

More of these modern dessert places are popping up and it makes Arizona more fun! I got an ice cream cone that was "infused" with Cinnamon Toast Crunch and strawberries as a topping. I thought it was enjoyable, but there were some cereal parts that were oddly chewy, like they've gone stale. The place looks very comfortable and it has cute, modern decor that you can take pictures with. Either the marble table, the palm leave wallpaper, the grey walls, or the "succulent" wall that has a glowing sign which reads, "Drip it like it's hot." It's a cute place and it has some creative ice cream flavors. My cousin got a matcha drink and the matcha is very high grade, but we both thought it was very heavy on the matcha.
I the ice cream , great Coustumer services ,clean place, LOVE LOVE There matcha te definitely coming back , friendly environment .

I have been to this place a few times. They have ice cream infused with cereal or milk tea drinks. The cereal-infused ice cream is a pretty neat concept. I don't think I have been to another dessert shop that does this. They definitely give you a lot of toppings. This is a great place for meeting up with friends after a meal and we just want something light to snack on and catch up. The drinks in my opinion weren't as great as other places. I ordered the jasmine milk tea which was a little light compared to other boba shops. However I really love matcha and will have to try their matcha drinks next time.
Tatum walks up before we leave and says "you have the best ice cream!" Yummy and unique. Def going back and coming from Scottsdale, I must say it's worth the drive. Get it!!! Greg #myfitmortgage

I recently moved to the area, and as a passionate foodie, was looking for a new boba/ice cream shop to feed my cravings! Search no further! The decor is beautiful, and the staff were friendly; they gave some recommendations of their popular drinks, and they also do seasonal ones too! I decided to go with the Rose Milk Tea which has hints of floral notes; absolutely refreshing and not too sweet. My friend created his own ice cream with toppings, but don't worry, they've got popular creations of their own if you can't make up your mind. Overall, a great quality dessert place, and I will definitely be back!

We got the cookie monster special which is the blue ice cream with mini cookies and oreo crumbs, and a cone with fruity pebbles mixed in and topped with marshmellow charms. The marshmallow charms were stale. The blue ice cream was noticeably less cold than the vanilla ice cream and had a paste like consistancy, but the cookie monster tasted good.

My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday around 3pm and we expected a long line of people. To our surprise, it was just us and 2 other people. The inside was clean and well kept except for the couch they have. We figured a lot of people like to sit on that couch so there's some ice cream stains on it. It was our first time here and the menu is very self explanatory so it's easy to order what you want. The service was great, we enjoyed our ice cream and milkshake. Would definitely recommend to a friend!
Great menu with a great selection! I ordered ice cream and a rose milk latte and both were phenomenal! Staff were super nice and helpful! The orders came out so fast
Best Boba I've ever had. I'm a hardcore Boba fanatic. Really surprised as to the price. Wouldn't mind paying $2 more per cup to be honest.

My sister found this place on yelp and it looked like an awesome place to check out.OMG was I right!!They greeted us as we entered including anyone who entered and lemme tell ya this place got rather busy quick even though when we walked in there was only a couple people before us!Now I can see why! So many options regarding topping wise and mix in I loved it and the fact that they had all kinds of cereal options for you the mix in was amazing.I ended up getting a mix in swirl which consisted of a vanilla base ice cream and my choice of mix was lucky charms which they grinder into the ice cream yes!And I got a choice topping as well and I went with the marshmallow charms omg SOOOO GOOD! My sis ended up getting a matcha milk tea of some sort with boba! Hands down best ice cream place I've been to so far! Most def a place to go and check out if you're in the mood for some ice cream or drinks!
Absolutely amazing. Flavor combos are unreal ... if you like classic cereals, you have to visit this place!!

Great customer service, I ordered a Oreo flavor cone today. Everything seems alright until I finished half way and found a tissue inside my ice cream, I think I have swallowed a few pieces..I thought it was oatmeal at first........
This place is soo good super cute, highly recommend the Cookie Crisp ice cream. It was very cheap as well which I was surprised. I will definitely be back to try different flavors :-)

SO GOOD!!! Been here 3 times already and love it. Wasn't sure if ice cream and cereal would be a great combo but it is excellent! Never had an issue with staff or service even when they are busy. Will definitely be back :)
This place is BOMB! My husband and I LOVE all their milkshakes. Definitely has turned into one of our go to sweets joint. Perfection!
Super cool place. So many dairy free options and a very nice staff! I would highly recommend it!

I think the options are limited here and that limits the business model. This is a rewind business but lacks universal appeal. While cereal and ice cream appeal to some, the business needs to offer more variety for people who do not want more sugar coated cereal in their ice cream, especially at $5.95 for 2 scoops. A customer's glance does not highlight any unique ice cream flavors or any special process in preparation. No one spoke to us as a group of four and no one offered any advice or samples. To be honest, if you're going to sell ice cream you still need to highlight the ice cream.

Wow! Came in not expecting much else besides ice cream but they add cereal into it and it makes a WORLD of a difference. My order: strawberry shortcake Reminds me of the ice cream bar back in the day! Definitely coming back to try all the other signatures!

I looooOVe the matcha and thai tea with boba here!! The texture of the boba is always perfect. The fruity pebble infused ice cream is my fav for ice cream! Love the cute instagram-able and family friendly interior, and customer service is always so awesome!

Just had the strawberry short cake ice cream and my wife had the one with bananas and teddy graham crackers and both were really good! Thanks to Keith for recommending this place that his friend owns!
YUMMM!!!! I can't wait to try all of the different flavors! This place is a must try!
Came here for the first time and ordered the butterfly rose lemonade, it's really good. I'll come back again!
Very instagram-able interior, and the menu is easy to understand. I looove cereal but this takes it to a whole new level! My favorite is the Cap'n Crunch milkshake.

The ice cream is good and plentiful. The mix concept is different and the mixer is kinda cool to watch. The teas were decent and definitely pretty. Overall, it's a good spot and if I'm in the area again, I'd get an ice cream and a Tea to go.
Rose milk latte! It taste delicious, must try! We got there on the second day after grand opening and they were so kind to give us a discount as we missed their grand opening day :)

Such a unique concept, yet so simple. Cereal infused ice cream. My mouth is watering just thinking about how good this ice cream is. They even have a dairy free option which my daughter took advantage of. Would definitely recommend this joint to everyone and plan to go back in the near future.
It was the best ice-cream. My daughter loved it as well. We will be back soon. Don't forget to order macha coco together with your ice-cream. It was perfect match.

Excellent, fresh ice cream with many eclectic toppings (and a drill to make room for them in the ice cream!) make Dripps a great place to go for dessert or a tasty treat. The iced Matcha green tea latte is absolutely delicious and a great way to get some antioxidants. Took one star off for the smaller space and time to wait for order. Otherwise, the food, drinks & service is top notch!

Love this place! We come here on the regular. Their ice cream is delicious (strawberry shortcake is my fave) and their jasmine milk tea is pretty good too. A HUGE plus that they also have a non-dairy option.
Very good ice cream and friendly management. Great place. They were very helpful in getting thing together to celebrate our grandson's birthday. Had a great time!

Wonderful new addition to the area. I thought it would be just another ice cream place, but I was pleasantly surprised to learn differently. This was my first experience with Matcha. The employees have answered all my questions and take excellent care of me. I feel welcome each time I come in with a hello and focused attention. Definitely a new favorite of mine!

I've been here a few times and the tea is pretty good. We are currently here and it has been over 30 minutes and we are still waiting for our tea. There is only one person working and he continues to take orders even though he was backed up. Probably won't come here again. On a personal note, we didn't care for the music either.
Kinda pricey and my one order took 15 minutes. Think I'll just go to Culver's next time
